intro: Astragalus colliculus, commonly known as the mountain milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus colliculus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for wildlife in its native range.
